intro: Erodium ciconium subsp. sennenii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pink to purple in color, with five petals, and bloom in early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
